result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 208 days (08-31-2015 to 09-04-2015, 09-30-2015 to 11-01-2015, 12-08-2015 to 05-25-2016) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance Black

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

cf

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 208 days (08-31-2015 to 09-04-2015, 09-30-2015 to 11-01-2015, 12-08-2015 to 05-25-2016) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Exhibit List, received and filed. tk

At the hour of 3:57 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of guilty which was then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Lance Black, GUILTY of possessing a controlled substance, tetrahydrocannabinols, as charged in the Information." 

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 4:01 pm jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-25-2016 at 8:15 am, branch 17.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 At the hour of 2:00 jury back in box.
Resworn for defense: Defendant Lance Black.  Exhibit 3 received. 
Defense rests.  
State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  
Jury out of box at 2:08 pm.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  
Jury in box at 2:24. Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense. Side bar requested. Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:04 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Fox and Campbell who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Side bar placed on the record. Question received and filed.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
At the hour of 10:06 am jury back in box.
Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the state:  Officer Ryan Schultz- West Allis Police Department. 
Side Bar requested.
Sworn for the state:  Officer Lucas Binter- West Allis Police Department.  
Sworn for the state:  Officer Sharif Said- West Allis Police Department.  Exhibit 1 received.
Sworn for the state: Laura Heddem- Wisconsin State Crime Lab Analyst. Exhibit 2 received. 
State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 11:00 am.  Side bar placed on the record. 
Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Case passed.
Case recalled same appearance. Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.
Jury in the box at 11:32 am. 
Sworn for defense: Defendant- Lance Black.  
At the hour of 11:59 am jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:30 pm on 05-24-2016, branch 17.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk
At the hour of 1:55 pm jury back in box. Voir dire continued.  Jury out of the box at 3:18 pm. Jury in the box at 3:50 pm.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.   Court instructed jury.   At the hour of 4:548 jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 9:00 am on 05-24-2016, branch 17.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:39 am.  
At the hour of 11:57 am jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:30 pm on 05-23-2016, branch 17.
Jury List - received and filed. tk
JURY PANEL ORDERED. TK

Final pretrial held. Case remains in a jury trial posture. Today is the last day court will accept plea negotiations. No pending issues remain. Parties to have any written stipulations submitted to the court no later than 05-23-2016 at 9:00 am. Speedy Jury trial scheduled for 05-23-2016 at 9:00 am, Branch 17. Case adjourned for jury trial, branch 17.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Peter A. Hahn on behalf of Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Doctor's report received and filed.
Competency Hearing proceeded.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  State does not challenge Dr. Rawski report and waives hearing.  Defense does not challenge Dr. Rawski report and waives hearing.  Defendant does not challenge Dr. Rawski report and waives hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court lifted remand and reinstated $750.00 Cash bail. All condtions remain the same. Case proceeded to final pretrial.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Proceedings suspended.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.   Peter A. Hahn appeared for Attorney Chad Wozniak the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  
Final pretrial proceeded.held. For reasons stated on the record defense counsel requested compentency evaluation. Court vacates Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Return on Doctors Report on 5/9/2016 at 8:30 a.m.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on 03-30-2016, expires  06-28-2016. 

(EDIT on 05-09-2016: Due to compentency and proceeding were suspended: Speedy Trial expires on 07-24-2016).

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Copies given to state and defense counsel. 

Parties to provide reports/summary of expert witness no later than 04-06-2016 by 5:00 pm. Any motions challenging the admissibility of proposed expert testimony due no later than 04-13-2016 by 5:00 pm. 

Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 04-14-2016 at 1:30, and Jury Trial scheduled on 04-25-2016 at 9:00 am, Branch 17.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Oral ruling proceeded. Court placed findings of fact on the record. Court denied defense motion. Case proceeded to scheduling conference.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for motion hearing. Sworn for the State: Office Ryan Schultz- West Allis Police Department. Sworn for the State: Officer Lucas Binter- West Allis Police Department. Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to testify. Closing arguments. Case adjourned for oral decision on 03-30-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17. FILE RETAINED IN COURT. 
  Oral ruling scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State's Response to Defendant's to Defendant's Motion to Suppress, received and filed. tk
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of Unlawful Arrest, received and filed. tk

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant Lance Black not in court, in custody. Peter Hahn on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Court in jury trial on another matter. Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Defense filed motion today. Motion is dispositive. Case adjourned for motion hearing on 03-29-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Letter from Christopher P. Ehrfurth, Attorney at Law filing Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Anthony Cotton on behalf of attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth. Defendant Lance Black in custody. Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for status of counsel.   Defense counsel received discovery.  Any motions due no later than 02-16-2016 at 8:30. Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 02-16-16 at 8:30, Branch 17. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for status conference. Defendant requesting an new attorney. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Court notes no nothe change of attorney will be granted unless for good cause. Case is adjourned for status of counsel to on 01-15-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel of Record, received and filed. tk

State's Motion in Limine

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. 
- ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Lance Black not in court, in custody. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets bail of $750.00. For reasons placed on the record, Court adjourned case for  status conference on 01-04-2016 at 8:30 am, Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant cleared by the Milwaukee County Sheriff and in original warrant in file.  Parties notified.  Case is scheduled for return on the bench warrant, Branch 17 on 12-08-2015 at 1:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Matt Last in court.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for bail/bond hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. On the State's motion, court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense. Final pretrial and Jury trial are vacated.
Court set bail bond hearing on 12-02-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Parties notified.

Case calendared for bail/bond hearing.
Bail motion by defense argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Signature Bond Set at $100.00.  All conditions remain the same.  Case remains calendared for final pretrial conference and jury trial.

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Matt Last.  Randy Sitzberger for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lance Black in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Lance Black in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lance Black not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/4/15 @ 1:30 pm
